page.title: 04THE MEON VALLEY LINE
page.content: This railway line opened in l903 as a through line from Waterloo to Gosport and Stokes Bay. Closed in l955, several features remain. From the attractive Privett station (now a private house) the line can be traced through a deep cutting in the N/E, invisible from the road. All the Privett children know where, beyond the thick bramble hedge, to find the slope leading to the tunnel entrance - a magnificent brick archway hidden in the cutting. The tunnel runs beneath the village for 1056 yards emerging in farmland in the south.From here the line crossed the A272 on a road tunnel, still a well-known landmark. The inn opposite the Old Station House, originally the "Privett Bush", now the "Pig & Whistle", was built to serve rail passengers.The 5 cottages nearby used to house railwaymen.
